clinical_study.brief_title: BEhavioral EConomics for Oral Health iNnovation Pilot Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Financial Incentives on Oral Disease Management in Young Children: A Randomized Pilot Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase I randomized pilot trial will assess the efficacy of a fixed incentive payment program and drawing incentive payment program versus a control program to promote early childhood caries (ECC) preventive health behaviors (i.e., toothbrushing performance and dental visit attendance) for young children of predominantly Latino parents/caregivers enrolled in/waitlisted for Early Head Start (EHS) home visit programs.

detailed_description.textblock: If both groups are acceptable and feasible, the reward group with toothbrushing outcomes at least 20% better than the other one (and the control) will be chosen for a future Phase II/III trial; if they are similar, the fixed monetary reward will be used because it is simpler to explain, monitor, and implement.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Eligible consenting parent-child participant dyads, within strata and permuted blocks, will be randomized in equal allocation to one of three arms. Strata will be based on smartphone operating system (iOS or Android).
study_design_info.masking_description: An independent outcomes assessor and PIs will be blinded to participants' group assignment, and participants will be told that the examiner and PIs cannot answer any incentive questions and they should not mention the incentive program to them. (Due to the nature of the intervention, the staff explaining the study arms after randomization and providing the incentive gift cards at follow-up visits cannot be blinded.)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean number of qualifying half-day toothbrushing episodes per week
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline visit through the Month 2 visit
primary_outcome.description: Mean number of qualifying half-day episodes per week in which a parent/caregiver brushes a child's teeth. (A Bluetooth-recorded toothbrushing episode qualifies if it lasts at least one minute within one of 14 half-day windows in the week.)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers attending a dental visit
primary_outcome.description: In the subset of children at baseline with no dental visit in the EHS ChildPlus health module, whether or not the child has a ChildPlus documented dental visit at the two-month follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of weeks the parent/caregiver synced toothbrushing data with the app
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of weeks the parent/caregiver synced toothbrushing data with the app

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean number of days per week with parent/caregiver-reported twice daily brushing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline visit through the Month 2 visit
secondary_outcome.description: Twice daily brushing with fluoridated toothpaste, based on parent/caregiver-reported frequency diaries

secondary_outcome.measure: Fluoridated toothpaste use
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline visit through the Month 2 visit
secondary_outcome.description: Change in child toothpaste pump weight

secondary_outcome.measure: Child plaque score
secondary_outcome.description: The child's Debris Index component (plaque score) of the Simplified Oral Hygiene Index (Greene and Vermillion) modified to include only maxillary incisor teeth after disclosing with plaque solution. The scale (which is a mean value) range is 0 (no debris or stain) to 3 (soft debris covering more than two thirds of the exposed tooth surface).

secondary_outcome.description: Willingness of LA County EHS to sign memoranda of understanding

secondary_outcome.measure: EHS staff participation
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness of EHS staff participation in assisting with recruitment

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers who consent
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness of parents/caregivers to provide informed consent and approve access to ChildPlus dental visit data

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers willing to be randomized
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness of parents/caregivers to be randomized to a study arm as part of the consenting process

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers adhering to study procedures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline visit through the Month 2 visit
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness of parents/caregivers to adhere to study procedures, including completing questionnaire instruments, bringing toothbrushing frequency diaries to 2-month follow-up visit, and bringing toothpaste pump to 2-month follow-up visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children who cooperate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline visit through the Month 2 visit
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness of child to cooperate with study procedures, including dental screening, extraoral photo, and plaque assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers willing to use the toothpaste pump
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline visit through the Month 2 visit
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness to use the toothpaste pump (percentage with any use and percentage change in pump weight)

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of measuring toothbrushing frequency with diaries
secondary_outcome.description: Bringing toothbrushing diaries to the follow-up visit and willingness to provide them to study staff

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of using toothpaste pump weight as a measure of usage
secondary_outcome.description: Bringing the toothpaste pump to the follow-up visit for weighing

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers willing to use the disclosing solution
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness of children to comply with the plaque disclosing procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers willing to use photographs for central assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness of the child to allow photographs, the ability to transmit the photographs securely, and the ability of the central clinician to score them reliably and confidently

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers willing to use smart powered toothbrush
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness to use the smart powered toothbrush handle (percentage with any brushing data)

secondary_outcome.measure: Comfort with smart powered toothbrush
secondary_outcome.description: Child and parent comfort level with using the smart powered toothbrush

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers willing to use smartphone app
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness to download the smartphone app and keep it for the duration of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of parents/caregivers willing to receive text messages
secondary_outcome.description: Willingness to be contacted with study-related text messages each week during the intervention period

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of syncing toothbrush to app
secondary_outcome.description: Successfully synced the toothbrush to app during baseline visit

arm_group.description: Eligible to earn a weekly payment during the 2-month incentive intervention period. Possible weekly winnings depend on toothbrushing performance collected through smart powered toothbrush synced to a smartphone app: low adherence threshold (brushing child's teeth once per day for 7 days in a week) will win $5; high adherence threshold (brushing twice per day for 14 days in a week) will win $10.

Eligible to earn a weekly drawing entry with different winning probabilities during the 2-month incentive intervention period. Possible weekly winnings depend on toothbrushing performance collected through smart powered toothbrush synced to a smartphone app: low adherence threshold (brushing child's teeth once per day for 7 days in a week) will have an 18% chance of winning $25 and a 1% chance of winning $50 (expected $5 payout); high adherence threshold (brushing twice per day for 14 days in a week) will have a 34% chance of winning $25 and a 3% chance of winning $50 (expected $10 payout).

No rewards during the first 2-months, but information on toothbrushing performance collected through smart powered toothbrush synced to a smartphone app. After the Month 2 follow-up visit, may opt to participate in a delayed 2-month open label extension to earn the same monetary rewards the fixed incentive intervention group could earn Baseline through Month 2. Not a formal part of this trial, but rather a necessary condition to assure all participating parents/caregivers have the chance to earn the same monetary incentives.

intervention.description: The Fixed Incentive intervention is a fixed reward, in which participants are eligible for fixed weekly payments based on toothbrushing performance collected through smart powered toothbrush synced to a smartphone app.

The Drawing Incentive intervention is a drawing reward, in which participants are eligible for weekly payments based on toothbrushing performance collected through smart powered toothbrush synced to a smartphone app.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for Parent/Caregiver:
- Provide signed and dated informed consent form in English or Spanish.
- Agree to comply with all study procedures and be available for the duration of the study visit.
- Male or female, aged 18 and older.
- Speak, read, and write either English or Spanish.
- Be a parent or caregiver of a child at least 6 months old but less than 3.5 years (42 months), with at least 2 fully erupted teeth and enrolled in, or waitlisted for, one of the three participating Los Angeles County EHS home visit programs.
- Not be planning to move residence for the next 6 months outside the greater Los Angeles area.
- Own a smartphone with the Google Play or iTunes store and be willing to download the smart powered TB app
- Be willing to be contacted via text-messaging (SMS) for study related notifications, such as incentives earned or reminders to sync the TB
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergic reaction to components of the study product(s).
- Uncooperative or behaviorally unsuited (assessed during a TB prophylaxis at the initial baseline study visit).
- A sibling of a child already enrolled in the study (the family's oldest child in the eligible age range will be the study child).
- Enrolled in foster care.
- Anything else that would place him/her at increased health risk or preclude the individual's full compliance with or completion of the study.
